column3: Give my regards to the boss.

column2: 気をつけて行ってくるんだよ
寄り道するんじゃないよ
盗賊が街に潜んでるとか…
column3: that there are bandits hiding out in town.
Although\. I figure you two will be okay.

column2: まっすぐ帰りますから\.
column3: Don't worry\c\. I'll head straight home.

column2: ボクの用事はすぐ終わると思うので
聞いてなかったでしょ
わたし 仕事まで時間あるから\.
column3: I have a little time before work.\.

column2: 一緒に市場まで遊びに行かない？
column3: Want to come to the market with me?

column2: カイト 驚き・動揺
寄り道するなって\N[6]さんが…
column3: \N[6] just said not to take any detours.

column2: 市場には人がたくさんいるし…
column3: There will be plenty of people
as long as we don't go too far in.

column2: カイト 驚き・動揺
はぐれなきゃ大丈夫だと思う
column3: I suppose we should be fine
column4: as long as we don't get separated.

column2: じゃあ 市場まで行ってみよ！
column3: Let's head to the marketplace then!
(I'll just stick with \N[2] for a little bit.)
